intro: Ricinocarpus spachianus, commonly known as the African rock apple, is a deciduous tree native to Africa and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appearance and has some traditional uses in local communities.
